rules.name: infectious
rules.treatment_summary: Management depends on confirmed diagnosis, severity, and comorbidities. Early clinical review and timely referral reduce complications.
medicine_guidance: Use medicines only after diagnosis confirmation by a licensed clinician.
Avoid self-use of antibiotics, steroids, or injections.
Paracetamol-type fever/pain relief may be advised in selected cases.
Hospital treatment may be required for moderate or severe disease.
home_care: Maintain hydration and rest.
Follow hygiene and infection-prevention measures.
Monitor temperature and symptom progression.
Seek timely follow-up if symptoms persist or worsen.

rules.name: cardiovascular
rules.treatment_summary: Long-term management combines lifestyle risk reduction, regular monitoring, and physician-guided medicines.
medicine_guidance: Cardiac medicines should be started and adjusted only by a doctor.
Do not stop BP/heart medicines abruptly.
Drug combinations and doses depend on clinical profile.
Emergency protocols apply for acute chest pain or neurological deficits.
home_care: Reduce salt and tobacco exposure.
Maintain physical activity as medically advised.
Track blood pressure and risk factors regularly.
Keep scheduled follow-up visits.

rules.name: respiratory
rules.treatment_summary: Treatment plans are guided by severity and often combine controller care, trigger control, and rescue protocols.
medicine_guidance: Use inhalers or oral medicines exactly as prescribed.
Controller and reliever therapies serve different roles.
Avoid self-starting steroids without clinical review.
Urgent oxygen/hospital care may be required in severe episodes.
home_care: Avoid smoke, dust, and known triggers.
Use breathing exercises and hydration support.
Keep action plan for worsening symptoms.
Follow vaccination and prevention advice.

rules.name: endocrine
rules.treatment_summary: Management is usually long-term and combines structured lifestyle plans with physician-guided medicines.
medicine_guidance: Do not self-adjust endocrine medicine doses.
Routine lab monitoring guides treatment decisions.
Medication timing and adherence are important for outcomes.
Special situations (pregnancy, elderly, CKD) require individualized plans.
home_care: Follow nutrition and activity guidance.
Track key metrics such as sugar/BP/weight as advised.
Maintain medication schedule consistently.
Keep periodic specialist follow-up.

rules.name: neurological
rules.treatment_summary: Neurological conditions need early clinical diagnosis and cause-specific therapy with follow-up monitoring.
medicine_guidance: Use neurologic medicines only under specialist guidance.
Do not stop anti-seizure or chronic neurologic medicines suddenly.
Acute neurologic emergencies require immediate hospital care.
Rehabilitation therapy may be part of treatment.
home_care: Maintain safety precautions and regular sleep.
Track episodes and triggers.
Support medication adherence and rehab plans.
Seek early help for new deficits.

rules.name: gastrointestinal
rules.treatment_summary: Treatment depends on cause and may include hydration, diet adjustments, and clinician-prescribed medicines.
medicine_guidance: Use prescription gastrointestinal medicines only after diagnosis.
Avoid prolonged self-medication for persistent symptoms.
Oral rehydration support may be required for fluid loss.
Targeted therapy is needed when infection/inflammation is confirmed.
home_care: Use safe food and clean water.
Eat light, balanced meals.
Maintain hydration.
Track stool/vomiting/abdominal pain changes.

rules.name: mental-health
rules.treatment_summary: Care combines counselling-based therapy, social support, and medicines for selected moderate-severe cases.
medicine_guidance: Psychiatric medicines should be prescribed and monitored by clinicians.
Do not stop mental-health medicines abruptly.
Therapy and lifestyle support improve outcomes.
Self-harm thoughts need immediate emergency support.
home_care: Maintain regular sleep and routine.
Stay socially connected and seek counselling support.
Avoid alcohol/substance misuse.
Escalate early for worsening symptoms.

rules.name: musculoskeletal
rules.treatment_summary: Management includes pain control, physiotherapy, mobility support, and specialist interventions when required.
medicine_guidance: Pain medicines should consider kidney/GI/cardiac safety.
Long-term anti-inflammatory use needs medical supervision.
Condition-specific medicines may be needed for inflammatory disease.
Procedural/surgical care may be advised in advanced cases.
home_care: Follow joint-strengthening and flexibility exercises.
Use weight and posture management strategies.
Apply local heat/cold as advised.
Avoid high-risk strain during flare-ups.

rules.name: dermatology
rules.treatment_summary: Skin care generally includes trigger control, topical therapy, and specialist review for recurrent or severe disease.
medicine_guidance: Use topical medicines only for recommended duration and strength.
Avoid steroid-combination creams without clinical advice.
Systemic therapies require clinician monitoring.
Treat secondary infection as prescribed.
home_care: Keep skin clean and moisturized.
Avoid irritants and scratching.
Use breathable clothing and hygiene measures.
Follow dermatology follow-up for persistent lesions.

rules.name: oncology
rules.treatment_summary: Cancer care is stage-based and usually combines surgery, systemic therapy, radiation, and supportive care under specialist teams.
medicine_guidance: Cancer medicines require specialist oncology prescription and monitoring.
Do not use alternative or over-the-counter products as cancer replacements.
Treatment cycles and side-effect monitoring are individualized.
Urgent hospital review is needed for fever, bleeding, dehydration, or severe weakness during treatment.
home_care: Maintain nutrition and hydration with symptom-directed support.
Track fever, pain, appetite, and weight regularly.
Follow infection prevention advice during immunosuppression.
Keep all oncology follow-ups and treatment schedules.

rules.name: trauma-toxicology
rules.treatment_summary: Injury and poisoning require rapid severity assessment, stabilization, and cause-specific emergency management.
medicine_guidance: Poisoning care should be hospital-guided; do not induce vomiting unless advised by clinicians.
Pain medicines and antibiotics should follow doctor evaluation of injury type.
Tetanus prophylaxis may be required in wound injuries.
Fracture and major trauma may need imaging, procedures, or surgery.
home_care: Use first aid and immobilization for suspected fractures or severe sprains.
Keep wounds clean and covered using sterile dressing.
Avoid unverified home antidotes for poisoning.
Monitor for swelling, fever, worsening pain, or reduced limb movement.

rules.name: obstetric-maternal
rules.treatment_summary: Maternal care requires structured antenatal/postnatal follow-up, risk stratification, and timely institutional referral.
medicine_guidance: Use pregnancy medicines only when prescribed as pregnancy-safe by clinicians.
Iron, calcium, folic acid, and vaccinations should follow ANC protocols.
Avoid self-medication, herbal formulations, or non-prescribed painkillers in pregnancy.
High-risk pregnancy signs require immediate facility-based care.
home_care: Attend all ANC/PNC visits and track blood pressure and fetal movements.
Maintain hydration, balanced diet, and adequate rest.
Keep MCP card and emergency referral plan ready.
Seek early care for reduced fetal movement, bleeding, or severe swelling.

rules.name: neonatal-perinatal
rules.treatment_summary: Perinatal and newborn conditions need early clinician assessment, thermal care, feeding support, and referral for complications.
medicine_guidance: Newborn medicines and dosages must be strictly clinician-prescribed.
Avoid home antibiotics or syrup dosing without pediatric advice.
Breastfeeding support and neonatal monitoring are core interventions.
Infections, jaundice, and breathing issues may require urgent NICU care.
home_care: Ensure warmth, clean cord care, and exclusive breastfeeding support.
Track feeding frequency, urine output, and activity levels.
Maintain hygiene and avoid unclean traditional applications.
Seek immediate care for poor feeding, fever, or lethargy.

rules.name: genitourinary
rules.treatment_summary: Genitourinary care depends on diagnosis and may require infection control, obstruction management, or long-term renal follow-up.
medicine_guidance: Use antibiotics and kidney-related medicines only on prescription.
Dose adjustments are needed in chronic kidney disease.
Avoid nephrotoxic self-medication and unsupervised painkiller use.
Severe urinary retention, sepsis, or renal dysfunction needs urgent admission.
home_care: Maintain hydration unless fluid restriction is advised.
Track urine output, swelling, and blood pressure changes.
Use hygiene measures to reduce recurrent infections.
Follow nephrology/urology follow-up plans.

rules.name: hematology
rules.treatment_summary: Blood disorders need cause-based treatment with lab monitoring, supportive care, and specialist referral when severe.
medicine_guidance: Iron, vitamin, transfusion, or disease-specific therapies should be clinician-guided.
Do not self-use blood-thinning or clotting medicines.
Platelet/coagulation disorders need monitored treatment plans.
Severe anemia, bleeding, or infection risk requires urgent review.
home_care: Follow nutrition plans aligned with diagnosed deficiency states.
Avoid trauma risk if platelet counts are low.
Track fatigue, pallor, fever, and bleeding symptoms.
Keep regular blood test follow-ups.
red_flags: High fever with low blood counts

rules.name: immunology
rules.treatment_summary: Immune disorders often require long-term monitoring with infection prevention and specialist-guided immunomodulatory care.
medicine_guidance: Immunosuppressive medicines require strict clinician monitoring.
Do not self-start steroids or biologics.
Vaccination and prophylaxis decisions should be individualized.
Prompt treatment is needed for suspected serious infections.
home_care: Follow hygiene and infection-prevention routines strictly.
Avoid known triggers in allergic/autoimmune conditions.
Keep medication adherence and lab-monitoring schedules.
Seek early care for fever or worsening inflammation.

rules.name: ophthalmology
rules.treatment_summary: Eye conditions need diagnosis-specific therapy and early referral to prevent avoidable vision loss.
medicine_guidance: Use eye drops/ointments only as prescribed for the diagnosed condition.
Do not use steroid eye drops without ophthalmic advice.
Infections, trauma, or glaucoma need urgent specialist evaluation.
Systemic diseases affecting vision require integrated care.
home_care: Avoid eye rubbing and use clean hand hygiene.
Protect eyes from dust, chemicals, and trauma.
Ensure proper lighting and screen breaks.
Follow follow-up schedules for pressure/retina monitoring.

rules.name: ent-hearing
rules.treatment_summary: Ear and hearing disorders require cause-specific care with infection control, hearing assessment, and procedural management when needed.
medicine_guidance: Use ear drops/antibiotics only after examination.
Avoid inserting oils, sticks, or unverified remedies in the ear canal.
Vertigo and sudden hearing loss need prompt evaluation.
Chronic/recurrent infections may need ENT specialist care.
home_care: Keep ear dry and avoid trauma from cleaning tools.
Control upper respiratory infections and allergies.
Track hearing changes, discharge, and dizziness episodes.
Use hearing support devices only after proper fitting.

rules.name: sleep-health
rules.treatment_summary: Sleep disorders are managed with sleep hygiene, behavioral therapy, and medical/device interventions for selected conditions.
medicine_guidance: Sleep medicines should be short-term and clinician-supervised.
Avoid sedative self-medication and alcohol-based sleep aids.
Sleep apnea may need formal study and CPAP-based management.
Evaluate coexisting anxiety, depression, or endocrine contributors.
home_care: Maintain fixed sleep/wake timings daily.
Reduce caffeine, nicotine, and screen exposure before bedtime.
Use a dark, quiet sleep environment.
Track snoring, daytime sleepiness, and sleep interruptions.
red_flags: Confusion or falls due to sedatives

rules.name: sexual-reproductive-health
rules.treatment_summary: Sexual and reproductive health conditions require confidential evaluation, diagnosis, partner care, and prevention counselling.
medicine_guidance: STI treatments should follow clinician-prescribed regimens with completion of full courses.
Avoid self-medication and incomplete antibiotic use.
Partner notification/treatment may be necessary for control.
Contraceptive choices should be individualized based on medical profile.
home_care: Use barrier protection and safe sexual practices.
Maintain genital hygiene and avoid irritant products.
Seek early testing for symptoms or high-risk exposure.
Follow counselling and follow-up plans.

rules.name: developmental-congenital
rules.treatment_summary: Developmental and congenital conditions require early screening, multidisciplinary care, and long-term functional support.
medicine_guidance: Therapies are individualized and may include medicines, procedures, or surgery.
Developmental medicines and supplements should be specialist-guided.
Regular growth and developmental assessments are essential.
Complicated cases need coordinated pediatric specialty referral.
home_care: Use early intervention services (speech, occupational, physiotherapy) when advised.
Track developmental milestones and nutrition.
Support caregiver training and safe home adaptations.
Keep immunization and routine pediatric visits updated.

rules.name: clinical-symptom-evaluation
rules.treatment_summary: Symptom-based entries indicate the need for structured clinical evaluation to identify the underlying diagnosis before definitive treatment.
medicine_guidance: Avoid repeated empirical medicine use without diagnosis.
Symptom relief may be used short-term with clinician advice.
Targeted treatment starts after relevant history, examination, and tests.
Escalate early if symptoms persist or worsen despite initial care.
home_care: Record symptom timing, triggers, and severity trends.
Maintain hydration, rest, and nutrition support.
Follow advised investigations and follow-up timelines.
Avoid combining multiple over-the-counter products unsafely.

rules.name: preventive-public-health
rules.treatment_summary: These entries focus on prevention, screening, rehabilitation, and care pathways rather than single-disease drug treatment.
medicine_guidance: Use preventive medicines and supplements as per public-health protocols.
Vaccination and prophylaxis schedules should follow national guidelines.
Chronic-risk management medicines need regular review.
Rehabilitation and follow-up planning are key parts of care.
home_care: Adopt healthy diet, activity, and tobacco/alcohol risk reduction.
Complete age-appropriate screening and immunization.
Track chronic-risk parameters (BP, sugar, weight) as advised.
Use local PHC/community health services for regular preventive care.

default.treatment_summary: Care depends on clinical severity and should be guided by a licensed clinician after proper diagnosis.
medicine_guidance: Do not self-start prescription medicines without clinical review.
Medicine choice and dose vary by age, comorbidity, and severity.
Complete prescribed courses and follow-up tests as advised.
Escalate to emergency care for rapidly worsening symptoms.
home_care: Maintain hydration, rest, and nutrition support.
Track symptom progression and warning signs.
Use hygiene and preventive care practices.
Consult PHC/doctor if symptoms persist or recur.
